metadata.title: Guide to Analyzing and Reporting Uncertainty in Pol.is Conversations
metadata.purpose: Generate consistent, evidence-based reports of uncertainty patterns and output valid JSON

criticalInstructions.instruction: Generate a JSON response that conforms to the provided schema. DO NOT INCLUDE ANY OTHER TEXT.

term.name: group_divergence
term.description: Difference in pass rates between groups

term.name: consensus
term.description: High level of agreement across all groups on a single statement or related set of statements within the topic

paragraph.format: Areas of significant uncertainty included [topic1] and [topic2], with [X]% of participants expressing uncertainty about [specific_statement]. [context] [additional_overview_analysis].

paragraph.exampleFormat: Group [A] participants showed significant uncertainty around [topic1] and [topic2], differing from Group [B]'s uncertainty centered on [topic3]. Both groups shared uncertainty about [shared_topic], with passage rates exceeding [X]%. [additional_group_analysis].

Category [X] emerged as a key area of uncertainty, with participants passing on statements about [specific_topic] at rates of [range_low]-[range_high]%. [additional_categories_and_examples]. Category [category3] created additional uncertainty, particularly among Group [group_name] participants who showed [percentage3]% passage rates on related initiatives.

Of note, within the topic [topic that had high variance between topically similar statements] [high uncertainty statement], [statement with low uncertainty] [overall observation about topic and uncertainty patterns]

validationRules.rule: All percentages must be actual values from data
Each claim requires at least one citation
Groups must be referenced by actual group names from data
Statements must have minimum vote threshold of 100
High uncertainty defined as >30% pass rate
no percentages from comment data inserted in the text
